content: Electronic/PDF Transcripts This service allows students and alumni to order official electronic/PDF transcripts via the web at any time, with worldwide delivery in about an hour. The electronic/PDF transcript option offers online order trackingâ€”with the time, date, and name of the person who received your record. No need to pay for FedEx! All transcripts from 1980 to the present can be delivered in an electronic/PDF format. PDF transcripts viewed electronically are recognized as official documents. A printed copy of a PDF transcript will be considered "unofficial" and will display the words "PRINTED COPY" on all pages of the PDF.

Restrictions Any financial hold on a student's account must be cleared before a transcript will be released, however, Illinois Tech provides official transcripts to students with outstanding balances if the student requests the official transcript to: complete a job application transfer from one institution of higher education to another apply for state, federal, or institutional financial aid join the United States Armed Forces or Illinois National Guard pursue other postsecondary opportunities In addition, Illinois Tech will provide an official transcript to a current or prospective employer notwithstanding a financial hold on the student's account. Students seeking an aforementioned exemption to the financial hold should contact Student Accounting. Payment for orders must be received before a transcript request will be processed.

Fees $10 for each electronic/PDF transcript $12 for each printed transcript sent via the United States Postal Service first-class mail (regular mail) Federal Express (FedEx) delivery service is available for an additional fee

Packaging for Paper Transcripts Transcripts are packaged in a sealed security envelope. If the seal is broken, the transcript is no longer deemed official. Attachments can be included with the transcript per your request. See the FAQ below for more information. If more than one transcript is being sent to the same address, they will be shipped in one large envelope containing each individually sealed transcript.

Unified Graduate Level Academic records for students pursuing doctoral-level credit prior to August 2016 have been consolidated into a unified graduate level record. This change incorporates credit hours, grades, quality points, and term grade-point average from the formerly separate master's and doctoral levels into a single graduate level moving forward. As a result, a recalculated cumulative grade-point average for combined master's and doctoral level credit appears on the official transcript. Credit earned at the graduate business or law levels remain separate and are not affected by this change.

section: Via the Illinois Tech Portal (Current Students)
chunk_id: Via the Illinois Tech Portal (Current Students)_0
content: Via the Illinois Tech Portal (Current Students) Log in to the Illinois Tech Portal . Type "Order Official Transcript" in the search bar. Click on the "Order Official Transcript" Tool. After placing your order, you will be contacted when your transcript request has been processed.

section: Via the Direct Link (Alums and Former Students)
chunk_id: Via the Direct Link (Alums and Former Students)_0
content: Via the Direct Link (Alums and Former Students) Visit Illinois Tech's Parchment page to complete the online order process and pay by credit card. After placing your order, you will be contacted when your transcript has been processed and mailed. If you do not have access to the internet, you may contact our service provider, Parchment, at 847.716.3005 for assistance with placing an order.

Illinois Student Debt Assistance Act In accordance with law, the university may not: refuse to provide an unofficial transcript to a current or former student on the grounds that the student owes a debt condition the provision of an unofficial transcript on the payment of a debt, other than a fee charged to provide the transcript charge a higher fee for obtaining an unofficial transcript or provide less favorable treatment of a request for an unofficial transcript because a current or former student owes a debt. In accordance with law, the university: must provide an official transcript of a current or former student to a current or potential employer, even if the current or former student owes a debt; may not condition the provision of an official transcript to a current or potential employer on the payment of a debt, other than a fee charged to provide the transcript may not charge a higher fee for transferring an official transcript to a current or potential employer or provide less favorable treatment for such a request because a current or former student owes a debt.

Additional Assistance and Questions If you have any questions regarding the online request system, please contact Parchment support and they will be able to answer any questions or assist you with ordering online.
Apostille Transcript If you require an apostille transcript, please visit our Apostille Certifications page for instructions.

Learn more... Illinois Tech welcomes you to join our community of people who discover, create, and solve. Apply today, visit us in Chicago, and contact us for more information. Request Info Visit Apply
